snippet: The Supreme Court declined to delay the death of Cecil Clayton, who had an I.Q. of 71 and lost 20 percent of his frontal lobe after a 1972 accident.
abstract: Cecil Clayton, Missouri man who killed Police Officer Christopher L Castetter in 1996, is executed after United States Supreme Court declines to postpone execution to allow for test of Clayton's mental competency; Clayton lost 20 percent of his frontal lobe in sawmill accident in 1972, leading to behavioral changes.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court declined to delay the death of Cecil Clayton, who had an I.Q. of 71 and lost 20 percent of his frontal lobe after a 1972 accident.

headline.main: Missouri Executes Killer Who Had Brain Injury
headline.print_headline: Missouri Executes Killer Who Had Brain Injury
